coolant_loop.description: Correlate coolant temperatures around the inverter and e-motor to verify thermal loop performance.

duty_cycle_profile.description: Classify trips (urban/mixed/highway) using sustained speed, torque stability, and duration.

efficiency_profile.description: Track conversion efficiency trends and degradation indicators across duty cycles.

power_delivery.description: Evaluate electrical input vs mechanical output along with electrical stress indicators.

sensor_health.description: Derived health readiness combining efficiency, torque spikes, thermal shocks, and power-quality stability.

thermal_envelope.description: Monitor inverter, stator, rotor, and DC bus temperatures to detect thermal stress and derating.

torque_balance.description: Compare commanded vs delivered torque to quantify drivetrain sluggishness or control saturation.

Efficiency__.description: Overall drivetrain efficiency expressed as the ratio of output power to input power (percentage).
domain_notes: High efficiency indicates minimal conversion losses; investigate cooling or calibration if efficiency trends degrade.
Pair with torque error to understand whether poor efficiency is linked to mechanical drag or electrical losses.
Efficiency__.friendly_name: Overall drivetrain efficiency expressed as the ratio of output power to input power (percentage)

metric.description: Ratio of output power to input power derived from raw telemetry.

Efficiency__.technician_note: Overall drivetrain efficiency expressed as the ratio of output power to input power (percentage). High efficiency indicates minimal conversion losses; investigate cooling or calibration if efficiency trends degrade. Pair with torque error to understand whether poor efficiency is linked to mechanical drag or electrical losses.

TorqueError_Nm.description: Torque measurement derived from inverter and motor control data (Nm).

usage: High-frequency drivetrain telemetry covering torque, thermal, electrical, and duty-cycle signals.
Use for time-window diagnostics, correlation analysis, and validating aggregated statistics.

domain_notes: Use as the reference mean when benchmarking vehicle performance.
fleet_avg.technician_note: Fleet-wide average value. Use as the reference mean when benchmarking vehicle performance.

domain_notes: Upper percentile threshold; vehicles above this value are outliers relative to the fleet.
fleet_p90.technician_note: 90th percentile across the fleet. Upper percentile threshold; vehicles above this value are outliers relative to the fleet.

domain_notes: Standard deviation gives variability context for z-score calculations.
fleet_std.technician_note: Fleet-wide standard deviation. Standard deviation gives variability context for z-score calculations.

sample_count.description: Number of telemetry samples used for the baseline.
sample_count.friendly_name: Number of telemetry samples used for the baseline
sample_count.technician_note: Number of telemetry samples used for the baseline.

signal.description: Signal name for which fleet statistics were computed.
signal.friendly_name: Signal name for which fleet statistics were computed
signal.technician_note: Signal name for which fleet statistics were computed.

usage: Fleet-wide baselines (avg, stddev, percentiles) computed directly from ev_signals for key signals.
Select from this macro when normalising vehicle metrics against fleet performance or computing z-scores.

avg_engine_speed.description: Average engine speed over the trip.
avg_engine_speed.friendly_name: Average engine speed over the trip
avg_engine_speed.technician_note: Average engine speed over the trip.

avg_speed.description: Average front axle speed over the trip.
domain_notes: Average speed for the trip window; useful for classifying duty cycle (urban vs. highway).
avg_speed.friendly_name: Average front axle speed over the trip
avg_speed.technician_note: Average front axle speed over the trip. Average speed for the trip window; useful for classifying duty cycle (urban vs. highway).

avg_torque_error.description: Average torque error (requested vs delivered) over the trip.
domain_notes: Trip-level torque stability metric; elevated values highlight repeatable drivetrain issues.
avg_torque_error.friendly_name: Average torque error (requested vs delivered) over the trip
avg_torque_error.technician_note: Average torque error (requested vs delivered) over the trip. Trip-level torque stability metric; elevated values highlight repeatable drivetrain issues.

sample_count.description: Number of telemetry samples within the trip.
sample_count.friendly_name: Number of telemetry samples within the trip
sample_count.technician_note: Number of telemetry samples within the trip.

domain_notes: Exposure window for each trip; use to weigh the significance of average metrics.

metric.description: Total active time using trip duration derived from telemetry gaps.

trip_duration_min.technician_note: Trip duration in minutes. Exposure window for each trip; use to weigh the significance of average metrics.

trip_end.description: Trip end timestamp derived from ev_signals.
trip_end.friendly_name: Trip end timestamp derived from ev_signals
trip_end.technician_note: Trip end timestamp derived from ev_signals.

trip_id.description: Sequential trip number per vehicle computed from telemetry gaps.
trip_id.friendly_name: Sequential trip number per vehicle computed from telemetry gaps

metric.description: Number of trip segments detected for the vehicle using telemetry segmentation.

trip_id.technician_note: Sequential trip number per vehicle computed from telemetry gaps.

trip_start.description: Trip start timestamp derived from ev_signals.
trip_start.friendly_name: Trip start timestamp derived from ev_signals
trip_start.technician_note: Trip start timestamp derived from ev_signals.

usage: Telemetry-derived trip segmentation with start/end timestamps, duration, and trip-level averages.
Ideal for duty-cycle analysis (urban vs highway), maintenance planning, and summarising behaviour without scanning raw telemetry repeatedly.

DerivedHealthScore.description: Derived health score combining subsystem penalties.
DerivedHealthScore.technician_note: Compute using efficiency, torque spike ratio, thermal event ratio, and unstable power ratio.
